'Racial/ethnic disparities in knowledge about one's breast cancer ..’

citation.abstract: Understanding tumor characteristics is likely important, but little is known about breast cancer patients' knowledge of their own disease. The authors assessed women's knowledge about their tumor characteristics, whether racial/ethnic disparities in knowledge exist, and whether education and health literacy influence associations.
citation.title: Racial/ethnic disparities in knowledge about one's breast cancer characteristics

news.title: Many women with breast cancer have poor knowledge about their condition
news.summary: Many women with breast cancer lack important knowledge about their illness, with minority patients less likely than white patients to know and report accurate information about their tumors' characteristics.

news.title: What's Up, Doc? Many Breast Cancer Patients Don't Understand Their Condition, But A Simple Convo With Their Doctor Could Help
news.summary: Many women don't understand the full extent of their breast cancer, and researchers say this may prevent them from making informed treatment decisions.

news.title: Many breast cancer patients have poor knowledge about their condition
news.summary: A new study finds that many women with breast cancer have poor knowledge about their illness, highlighting a need for better patient education to improve treatment decisions.
